title: Is there a way to lift a perma-ban
body:
Last year my account was banned because I was reported by a random. So basically some friends and I queued up for a blind pick match, there was 4 of us (This is including myself) in a party and there was a single random player. During the match there was some banter going around (Mainly it was me, but it was only kept between the four of us). So the random saw this and decided to report me and I got perma-ban.

Is there a way to remove the perma-ban? Because I've spent quite a good bit of money on that account.

replies.body:
While Necromancy may be handy (and sometimes needed) in media, it is not the case for old forum threads. Please avoid using such magic and be mindful of how old threads are before posting.

Feel free to contact us at the [Moderation Discord](https://discordapp.com/channels/230113905668653056/306220435262144512) or at [Discuss the Boards]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) for any questions, comments or concerns about this. Thank you and have a good day.

Nope.

You got banned for whatever you did, not because you got "reported by a random".

Bans are only lifted if they are found to be in error, which is more or less never the case for anything chat-related, and also unlikely there are any logs a year later.

Permbans also require either repeated prior restrictions or incredibly extreme behavior, it is a last resort for people who are incapable of learning how to function in a multiplayer game.
They only lift permabans when the punishment was given in error. If the "banter" broke Riot's rules for in-game behavior, the ban stays.
GG no re D:

Yeah I'm not shocked IFS picked this one up

Do you honestly believe that you deserve another chance after acting like this in your logs? If so then you need a wake-up call, because this kind of behavior is not banter and is completely unacceptable, so you can kiss any hope of getting your account back good-bye. Next time if you're gonna banter like this then keep it to a **FULL** premade rather than try to use the excuse of "oh this/these random player(s) didn't appreciate our banter and is/are at fault" because that won't work here. Oh and by the way sorry to break this to you but money spent on the game does not grant you immunity to the rules.

Should he not keep that kind of behavior/chat use out of League totally? If he uses team chat for that, someone from enemy team might still report him and IFS would slam him down with the hammer of judgement. 

(At least I don't believe IFS cares if the report comes from a person who doesn't see the chat) "If (reports>0) { PrepTheHammer(); } " .. (the code is about the one we use to believe that one report is as strong as nine - no checking for enemy team reports separately (the check could still be in the PrepTheHammer() functionality of course, but so could be some kind of weight for the number of reports))

> [{quoted}](name=Baka Red,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=1F5JeQ0x,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2019-03-27T09:26:54.722+0000)
>
> Should he not keep that kind of behavior/chat use out of League totally? If he uses team chat for that, someone from enemy team might still report him and IFS would slam him down with the hammer of judgement. 
> 
> (At least I don't believe IFS cares if the report comes from a person who doesn't see the chat) "If (reports>0) { PrepTheHammer(); } " .. (the code is about the one we use to believe that one report is as strong as nine - no checking for enemy team reports separately (the check could still be in the PrepTheHammer() functionality of course, but so could be some kind of weight for the number of reports))

There have been a couple cases where a punishment from a blind enemy report or a full premade custom game was overturned. Those are extremely rare, though, and required (I think) support tickets from the all the other players involved and an investgation to check whether the player had made any comments in /all chat.

I don't see the random player retracting their report here.

Thanks for your answer. Yes, I think I have seen one or two of those cases. However, even if their punishment might get overturned, it also might not. Maybe one of their friends was actually so badly insulted, that he doesn't want to help his ex-friend anymore. Or maybe the Support persons simply won't unlift the punishment (they are people too). Anyways, overturning one of these punishments requires work for both the punished and his friends and thus if the person values his account (and even if he doesn't) he should not use chat for that kind of language. Racism/Hate speech etc is bad, as we both know.

> [{quoted}](name=Baka Red,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=1F5JeQ0x,comment-id=0007000000000001,timestamp=2019-03-28T07:57:27.390+0000)
>
> Thanks for your answer. Yes, I think I have seen one or two of those cases. However, even if their punishment might get overturned, it also might not. Maybe one of their friends was actually so badly insulted, that he doesn't want to help his ex-friend anymore. Or maybe the Support persons simply won't unlift the punishment (they are people too). Anyways, overturning one of these punishments requires work for both the punished and his friends and thus if the person values his account (and even if he doesn't) he should not use chat for that kind of language. Racism/Hate speech etc is bad, as we both know.

Like I said, it's extremely rare.  I can think of one, *maybe* two cases over the past 8 years or so I've been playing and hanging around the boards/forums where the banned player's friends vouched for him and there were no randoms who weren't in on the "joke".

> [{quoted}](name=AJStarhiker,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=1F5JeQ0x,comment-id=000700000000,timestamp=2019-03-27T12:29:48.828+0000)
>
> There have been a couple cases where a punishment from a blind enemy report or a full premade custom game was overturned. Those are extremely rare, though, and required (I think) support tickets from the all the other players involved and an investgation to check whether the player had made any comments in /all chat.
> 
> I don't see the random player retracting their report here.

To add onto this while I do agree that it would be preferable if this kind of behavior was kept out of the game entirely, if one must act like that then it's best to do so with full premade full of like-minded people who you know won't report for it.

Yep, if the premade are unable to use some form of VOIP (which they should be using to make their premade group work more efficiently anyways) and absolutely have to use language that could cause IFS to punish them, they should only use chat for that with full premade and only team chat of course - and suffer the consequences, if someone reports them.

I guess I am too much of a tryhard, since I find that kind of behavior causing drops in team efficiency (well, any chat use that isn't game related (line or two for morale boosting is still game related) and thus I frown upon most non-game-related-chat-use. If premade enemy team waste their time by using their team chat for throwing insults at each other, I don't mind. I need all the edges I can get - I ain't that great a player after all. ;)

PS: Even if I "frown upon" something, that doesn't make that punishable of course and thus even if you type a lot you get no reports from me (as long as what you type isn't something 'bad').
PPS: Prandine, keep up the good work. :)

Racial and homophobic slurs are also insta ban.
No coming back from that one.
